lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Chakaee Chakavaa Bandhik Ikatr Keenay , Pinjaree Mai Basay Nisi Doukh Soukh Maanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a bird-catcher catches male and female ruddy sheldrake (Chakvi, Chakva) and put them in the same cage where they remain together for the night, they happily bear the pain of being prisoners because they are spared the pangs of separation for the night.

lines.gurmukhi: khq prspr koit surjn vwrau Et durjn pr jwih gih Awny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kahat Parasapar Koti Surajan Vaarau , Aot Durajan Par Jaahi Gahi Aanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: They feel so grateful to the hunter for catching them together and lodging them in the same cage that they sacrifice millions of good people unto him who has given them both a shelter.

lines.transliteration_english: Satiroop Satinaam Satigur Giaan Dhiaana , Satigur Mati Sati Sati Kari Jaanay Hai ?242?

Shabad OS B.translation: The practitioner of Lord's name regard His name that the True Guru has blessed him with as the eternal truth and living for ever. He regards and accepts the teachings of True Guru as true and true only. He meditates on Naam with complete devotion. (242)
